title: 9.1.3 CloudFront distribution scanner
body:
## Parent Epic
Part of Epic 9: Advanced Security Scanning (#127)

## Objective
Implement security scanning for Amazon CloudFront distributions checking for SSL/TLS configuration, origin access, logging, and security headers.

## Requirements
- Scan CloudFront distributions and configurations
- Check SSL/TLS certificate validity and security
- Verify origin access identity configuration for S3 origins
- Validate viewer protocol policy (HTTPS enforcement)
- Check for missing security headers (HSTS, CSP, X-Frame-Options)
- Verify logging configuration
- Detect distributions missing WAF integration
- Check for geo-restriction configuration when appropriate
- Analyze cache behavior security settings
- Integration with Intelligence-Builder SDK for CDN security analysis

## Security Rules to Implement
- CloudFront distribution allows HTTP (not HTTPS only)
- CloudFront distribution missing origin access identity for S3
- CloudFront distribution missing security headers
- CloudFront distribution missing logging
- CloudFront distribution missing WAF integration
- CloudFront distribution using outdated SSL/TLS protocols
- CloudFront distribution with public S3 bucket origin
- CloudFront distribution missing custom error pages
- CloudFront distribution cache allowing sensitive headers

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CloudFront scanner module implemented with all rules
- [ ] Scanner identifies all distributions across accounts
- [ ] Each rule produces clear finding with severity and remediation
- [ ] Integration with Intelligence-Builder SDK for CDN security analysis
- [ ] Unit tests cover all rules (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration test validates scanning against test distributions
- [ ] Documentation includes rule descriptions and remediation guidance
- [ ] Scanner performance: <5s per distribution

## Technical Approach
- Use boto3 CloudFront client for distribution discovery
- Parse distribution configurations for security settings
- Check associated S3 bucket policies for origin access
- Leverage Intelligence-Builder SDK for security header analysis

## Estimated Effort
16-20 hours

## Dependencies
- AWS CloudFront API access
- S3 bucket policy read permissions for origin verification
- Intelligence-Builder SDK integration
